item.title: Docs: How to change mouse buttons
item.description:
Karabiner-Elements does not modify mouse devices by default.

  1. You have to enable your mouse on Karabiner-Elements Preferences > Devices.

  2. Then, use Simple Modifications to assign a key to a button or use Complex Modifications for more advanced usage.

item.title: Docs: How to disable caps lock delay
item.description:
Enable Disable caps_lock delay setting from Complex Modification.

  1. Import Change caps_lock key setting.
  2. Enable Disable caps_lock delay.

Note

Actually, this setting does not disable the caps lock delay of macOS.

This setting puts a wait between caps lock key down and key up event in order to ensure macOS recognize the caps lock event.

item.title: Docs: How to adjust the key repeat rate
item.description:
Karabiner-Elements does not provide a feature to adjust key repeat rate.

Use System Preferences > Keyboard.

You can also adjust the key repeat rate using defaults write command. https://apple.stackexchange.com/questions/10467/how-to-increase-keyboard-key-repeat-rate-on-os-x

item.title: Docs: How to disable running Karabiner-Elements at login
item.description:
Karabiner-Elements will be started automatically at login after once you have run Karabiner-ELements.

Quit Karabiner-Elements if you want to stop running Karabiner-Elements at login.
